title: Picante Grill’s House Vinaigrette
ingredients: ½ cup canned whole tomatoes (with no salt added)
½ cup tomato juice (from the same can)
2 teaspoons salt; or, to your preference in taste
instructions: Place the tomatoes in the bowl of a food processor and pulse a few times until you have a “chunky blend” in the tomatoes.  (Keep in mind that in the finished product the salad dressing should be some what chunky.)  Pour the blended tomatoes into a bowl and add the tomato juice, garlic, onion, cilantro, cumin, oregano, salt, pepper, and vinegar.

Slowly pour in the olive oil and whisk briskly until all the ingredients are incorporated and well blended.  Pour the vinaigrette into a Mason jar and seal it tightly.  Refrigerate the vinaigrette overnight before using.
Before using, shake the jar vigorously to ensure the vinegar, oil and the ingredients are well blended before pouring onto the salad.
Source:  Picante Grill’s House Dressing (is) Unique, Chefs’ Secrets by Pat Mozersky, Taste Section of the San Antonio Express-News, Wednesday, June 21, 2006.
